data.title: El Expreso de la Robla: Bilbao to Leon | Holidays 2024/2025
data.meta_description: Luxury rail journey through Spain's northern coast with El Expreso de la Robla. Travel from Bilbao to Leon.
data.text:
After enjoying complimentary airport-lounge access, you'll fly out to Bilbao, make your way to your city-centre hotel for a one-night stay. As the only luxury accommodation opposite the city's gleaming jewel – the Guggenheim Museum – you'll have all of the city's highlights on your doorstep, with the rest of the day free to explore. There's also plenty of time to enjoy the superb tapas bars around the central Plaza Nueva.

After breakfast enjoy a free morning in Bilbao, wander through its alley-woven old town to find its 14th century cathedral and centuries-old tavernas, or take a walk along the river and climb up the Mallona Stairs for views over the entire city.

In the afternoon make your way to one of Bilbao's heritage buildings of its Belle Epoque era - La Concordia station where you'll board the El Expreso de la Robla. As you travel through the verdant countryside to Sotoscueva, you’ll settle into your wood-panelled Suite, complete with ensuite bathroom.

The next stop is Espinosa de los Monteros, a beautiful village in the Buros Merindades on the southern side of the Cantabrian mountains, here you will have dinner, before settling down for your first night on board in Espinosa.

Enjoying a delicious buffet breakfast, you’ll continue to Mataporquera. You will be met off the train to travel through the breath-taking landscapes of the Romanesque Palencia, Carrion de los Condes, with many historical sites to visit and enjoy. You will have free time to enjoy before continuing to Canal de Castilla and Fromista, with its impressive Romanesque church of San Martin.

After lunch visit the Roman Villa of La Olmeda and its magnificent collection of mosiacs. Back on board the La Robla Express in Cistierna and dinner, Overnighting in Cistierna.

Breakfast whilst travelling to San Feliz. From here we go by coach to visit the city of León to explore its historical centre, San Isidoro and the Cathedral. Free time, to end the trip at approximately 14:00.

Your accommodation for tonight is the historic Parador de Leon, the perfect location to explore the city where dotted around the streets are bars and restaurants where you can sample the best of the region's gastronomy and which have made it worthy of the nickname El Húmedo. Also you can continue your route on to the Palace of los Guzmanes and the Casa de los Botines. The main façade of the palace, dates back to the 16th century and featuring prominently on the building are the lattice balconies and the lateral façade. The Casa de los Botines, meanwhile, is the work of the architect Antonio Gaudí, who launched the modernist style in the city. León has more examples of this artistic trend in the square of Santo Domingo.

Stay: Parador de Leon (Deluxe)
